channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees overhanging shared footpath / cycleway, 9th June
item.description:
The path along the perimeter of Walls has a lot of overgrown, overhanging trees / bushes / brambles. It is necessary to duck to walk along there so can only be worse for cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface is damaged problem, 9th June
item.description:
Email received 05/06/2025 - copy attached: Hi team I've been advised that you are able to help with correcting the pathway in The Minster Churchyard Cheltenham. We see that there has been some utilities work at the Well Walk end of the churchyard pathway. We see that the utility chaps have put down black tarmac on the pathway – rather than the carefully selected resin-type surface. It is also noted that the brickwork paving on Well Walk has been put down a little unevenly, but better than before. The double yellow lines have been reinstated. It was raised at the end of February that the whole of Well Walk needs attention, including the yellow lines which have largely disintegrated. I understood that GCC are responsible for the lighting and pathways in The Minster Churchyard, as GCC was involved in the recent project to rejuvenate the area. This was in conjunction with Cheltenham Borough Council, The Diocese of Gloucester and our Church Council. If you could look in to this - particularly the reinstatement of the original pathway surface to match. It should also be noted that any work in The Minster grounds need acknowledgement from the church as it is a closed churchyard and still contains burial remains.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previous utility repair subsidence across the carriageway, 9th June
item.description:
A previous repair to the road by utility company which cut a channel from one side of the road to another has subsided. It’s probably at least 50 to 60 mm deep and the size of two large dinner plates.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 257, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface section needs replacing, 9th June
item.description:
At the end of Alma Road the surface causes cycles to alter speed and direction. Very poor quality road surface causing a hazard to stability on a bike. Road surface section needs replacing please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain, 9th June
item.description:
The drain outside Daneway House is blocked. This a new drain and the problem has been reported before. When it rains roadway water runs into the drain north of the drain in question - it then runs out of the new drain down the gutter. When it rains heavily some of the water runs down the driveway of Daneway House and Denman House.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown grass, 8th June
item.description:
The grass verge in planets lane is seriously overgrown Tewkesbury borough council have previously attended to it however they have said it is the responsibility of Gloucestershire Council now. The grass has not been cut in over 12 months and in places around a meter in height Please can it be attended to and cut as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Planets Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The area of grass opposite 23 Planets Lane requires serious attention- it is extremely overgrown, messy and weeds everywhere, 8th June
item.description:
The location of the problem occurs opposite 23 Planets Lane down to 12 Planets Lane It has come to my attention that this was maintained regularly by Tewkesbury Borough Council on behalf of yourselves, and this agreement has now terminated - please ensure this is actioned as soon as possible as it is now over a metre in height.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Planets Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
